intro: Parasenegalia grazielae, commonly known as the Grazielae parasenega, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
